P112713.project_name: Capacity Building in Public Financial Management

keywords.cdata: Bank, Borrower, Capacity Building, Consultants, consulting services, contracts, Currency, Disbursement, Disbursements, expenditure, expenditures, Finance, Financial Management, Financing, good, good governance, goods, Grant, ID, Information, Lending, Lending Instrument, Loan, operating costs, performance, procurement, procurement plan, Public, Public Financial Management, RESTRUCTURING, results, Technical Assistance, Trust Fund

project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Capacity Building in Public Financial Management (CB-PFM) Project for Kyrgyz Republic is to assist the recipient in strengthening the effectiveness, efficiency and accountability of the Public Finance Management (PFM) through strengthening the budget process, the internal audit and control function and the institutional and human capacity of the recipient's Ministry of Finance (MOF) and that of other line Ministries of the recipient. The project grant is supported by a multi-donor trust fund. The original grant was signed on November 2, 2009 and was granted an extension to December 31, 2014, on July 24, 2013. The Ministry of Finance has proposes to reallocate funds to reflect a revised work plan and procurement plan that has been approved by Bank and concurred with by the donors. The reallocation will establish a new category covering consulting services, training, seminars, goods, and operational expenses and move unused funding to this new category. The proposal does not change the project development objective (PDO).
